inn1.comm: leg-side wide to start. started on leg stump and gently swung on further
zipped back into the left-hander, cut him in half and struck him high on the thigh. It missed the protection and that clearly hurt
again jagged back in at 88mph, through Bray's rather half-hearted prod but was shooting down the leg side
attempted yorker, almost on the button but a foot too full, Bray digs it out well
a hairy first over ... Bray shaped to flick to leg, he missed and it hit him on the gloves and looped into the off side, quite safe but he had no idea where that had gone
full again, and this time Bray punches it off the back foot between cover and extra cover, well timed
the first one slanted across the right hander, Bray having none of it
good line, a fraction short, and Porterfield plays inside the line quite deliberately

again a tad short, this time Porterfield tried to get over it but it was too big for him and an edge flew to Gayle at firstslip ... regulation catch at chest height, and that's Porterfield's second duck in three matches
leg-stump line, Morgan shimmies to the off and the ball flicks his pads and runs very fine, no chance of anyone catching that
through Morgan for pace - 86.9mph - although headed down the leg
Morgan back and into line, all very correct and safe
outside off- fired across Morgan at 89.5mph, and he leaves alone
Bray into line and blocks into the off side
short at 86mph and that took off like this is a NASA test track, Bray withdrew and the ball roared over Ramdin's outstretched hands. He never had a chance
better line and more conventional bounce, Bray blocks
short and wide, slashed by Bray in the air but there's nobody at backward point and despite the shout of "catch" from Taylor, that was safe and it raced to the rope
bat and pad jammed together, blocked
good line and length - 86mph - and a solid defensive block
slanted across Morgan who sways back and leaves it
checked drive, mid-off is a bit too deep and Morgan calls for the quick single
too wide and left
Bray looks for another cut, it was a bit quicker than he thought and it was through him before he was there
loud and crisp appeal, Bray very late to jab his leg forward and that was hitting ... however, it pitched a foot outside the line and so a good decision
flicked off the pads, well timed and four all the way ... but Dwayne Smith leapt to his left to field. He was only about ten yards from the bat, so amazing reactions
a peach, right through Morgan who was left groping at air. 88mph ...
well played, leg stump, flicked past midwicket and Bradshaw does well to chase and limit them to two
outside off, Morgan not interested
caught back in the crease, a thick edge goes all along the ground to third man
short, pulled but not convincingly - I think it came off the toe of the bat - but still good enough to find the gap
short, hooked, Morgan not in control, although the ball flies off the top edge,  over the wicketkeeper's head and clears the rope right behind him by a couple of feet
short and well directed, Bray tries to sway out of the line but ends up running the ball off the face and wide of second slip. Powell snarls ...
Morgan takes a big stride forward, thrusts out a pad and lets it go
wrong line, outside leg, and flicked niftily down to long leg
tucked off his hip into the leg side, the ball goes no more than five yards and that allows them the quick single
half volley outside off, driven hard to Bradshaw at mid-off
full, driven but not timed and again Bradshaw fields
Bray forward, a decent line, blocked
short outside off, a wild swing from Bray, more baseball than cricket, and he misses. By a long way
eye of a needle, a lovely backfoot drive through point, finding a  gap between two men that didn't seem to be there
again a bit short, Bray looks to pull over midwicket but doesn't time it and it bobbles to mid-on
defended with bat and pad together, the ball bobbles between the two and trickles  through to the keeper
flicked off bat-hip to midwicket and the pair almost walk a single
short, Bray shapes to hook/uppercut but that's too high for even him and he ends up with his bat high above him like an aerial.
into Bray's body, an area where he looks far from happy, the ball hits him on the thigh pad, Bray briefly looks for a leg bye but it was never on as Powell races through to pick it up
body-line again ( as opposed to Bodyline) and once more Bray cannot cope with it. It's through him and he ends up off balance and the ball lobs off his thigh to slip
short, this time Bray sways out the way and lets it pass
outside off, another mow from Bray which misses
short and off side and Bray, given the room to free his arms, smacks that over the covers and it's four all the way
Morgan forward, pushes the ball firmly to mid-off
assured drive, Bradshaw collects in his follow through without breaking stride
turned between midwicket and mid-on, good placement and an easy run
turned to leg stump, worked with no pace to square leg
decent line - 79mph - and solidly blocked
full on off stump, Morgan jabs down and defends into the off side
outside off, Bray spars and misses
oh dear. Lara sets the field and then Powell bowls just how he didn't want. Short and wide, Bray steer/cuts that over gully and it's four all the way
better ... angled into Bray who gets forward to block
short outside off and dreadfully wild and overambitious wipe from Bray

Powell almost seems to be bowling under orders from Bray rather than his captain .... short, wide, and slashed over gully for another four.  Not controlled but he hit that with extra vim and that was travelling
another massive wipe from Bray to one outside the off stump, which he again misses
short, outside off and that's worked into the covers
drifting on to leg and that's played behind square with a mere hint of a tickle and that brings up Ireland's fifty, so it does
driven to mid-on
defended forward
played forward again for another dot
pitched up on middle-and-leg and the batsman doesn't have many ideas what to do with that one
across the lefthander with a touch of width and he plays that down off the back foot behind point
oh, hello. That was close and Bray knows he was nearly a gonner that time, stepping into the shot with a headrush of a whoosh into it, an attempted cover drive - so nearly got an edge there
straight and that's defended off the back foot into the covers
defended
crunched along the ground straight to the man at cover
played out to point and Bray bags the strike
down leg and the bottom hand comes up and off the bat with trying to play that into square
left-armer to lefthander and that's wide and driven through cover
on off and that's pulled very powerfully in front of midwicket, but Powell chases it down on the boundary, doing very well to cut off the runs with a sliding stop
good delivery, straight and that's defended
straight and tries to rush that off the back foot to midwicket
ooh, he likes the look of that one, short and wide, and the batsman cuts over the top, the ball nearly taking the under edge
defended forward
good delivery, outside off and tempting Morgan this time, trying to drive that one, but the length wasn't quite there - and he nearly had him
left alone outside off this time
got away with that one - a far-from-convincing uppish drive which sends the ball popping up in front of cover off a leading edge, bouncing agonisingly in front of the inner ring
dropped. Bray gets a let-off there, driving that straight to Samuels in the covers and he just shelled it. Powell is magnanimous there, just smiling and shaking his head
rushes that one past the outside edge
driven straight to cover
pushed right up there on off and that's defended straight into the ground in front of his toes and just sticks on the turf
outside edge pulled round behind square
rises on the balls of his feet and drives that straight to cover
on leg and that's worked to fine leg. Neat work with a pick-up-and-throw from Bravo which just misses the sticks by inches
defended on the back foot and will they run? No, they decide to "Wait there!"
defended into the covers
outside off and that's driven straight to the man at cover

comes down the wicket looking to hook that short one and that's a really good catch from the keeper Ramdin. He had to sprint a fair mile to pick that one, two other fielders in pursuit, too, and in the end he took it just inside the boundary with a showboating dive to make Cristiano Ronaldo proud. Nevertheless, that was some really excellent work
driven to cover, Bray facing because they crossed
worked into midwicket but a loud call of "No!" has everyone in no doubt whether they will be running or not
lovely ball to bring up an impressive wicket maiden, that one shooting over Bray's outside edge
on the money and O'Brien works his first ball tidily in front of short midwicket
just outside off, on a good length, and the batsman defends into that shot, working it into the short midwicket region
taken off the toes and that's played out to deep backward square leg where it's neatly returned
defended on the front foot into the covers
short, straying on to leg, and Bray's having difficulties in dealing with balls on that line, a bit of a blind spot for him. This time he heaves into the midwicket, but connects only with air
another pacy delivery from Bradshaw and that one takes an edge which flies behind the sticks and bounces way in front of Ramdin
down leg, short, and that's gone wide
defended on the front foot into the leg side
across the lefthander with a touch of width and that's driven into the covers
on leg and poked back into the midwicket region for a quick single
across the lefthander and that dies on the pitch, the ball hardly bouncing up much and the batsman cuts over it
attempted slower ball of a yorker, there, and the batsman drives the ball back into the ground at the bowler
wristed all the way to the boundary through midwicket
edge through gully and that's collected inside the third-man boundary and winged back in
worked off the front foot into short midwicket
driven slowly and straight to the man at cover
on a good length on off and that's defended tidily enough
slower ball, just back of a length, and that's played into the short midwicket region without much power
short, outside off, and that's deposited in front of the midwicket rope, with a neat flick up off the hips. Bravo impresses again by chasing it down
driven out to cover, straight to the man, but lest there be any doubt about the run there's a loud shout of "No!"
on off, dinked down, and that's well run with a tip-and-run style of single
left alone outside off, that one rushing through past the shoulder
defended down off the back foot
width outside off and that's played very strongly indeed of the back foot. That hits the rope, despite the best efforts of the chasing fielder
defended off the back foot and that rounds off the first 20 overs
pulled but an edge into body rather than a middle, and it bobbles down to long leg
that's a big wicket. O'Brien undone by a little movement off the seam, he fends and a clearcut edge is meat and drink for Ramdin as he takes a step to his left
very wide and Botha shoulders arms. A good one to have as a sighter
pushed into the leg side, a stroll to get off the mark
very correct forward defensive, head over the ball, cue purring noises at Lord's
Bray back and gently pats the ball back to Bradshaw
Botha pushes at a ball very wide of him, never over it, and he got away with it as the edge dropped a few feet short of second slip
Botha learned from his mistake and left one alone that was much closer to him
rather uppish drive, a thick edge down to third man. Quite safe, but Botha looks scratchy
living dangerously ... another edged drive which flies through third slip, all along the ground and Chanderpaul at third man can't cut that off
slower ball - 69mph - which Bray read and left

a limp end to a real curate's egg of an innings. An even slower ball - 67mph -  and a half volley as well, Bray drives and all he does is chip the ball to Lendl Simmons, the substitute, mid-off - a return to the bowler  goes harder than that - and he's on his way
short and Botha sways out of the way
prodded into the off side
more oohs ands aahs than a rollercoster ride as Botha swings and misses
lovely shot, wide and a half volley, Botha leans back and drives that with power through the covers
slower ball, Botha not fooled, he waits and blocks
hurried defence into the leg side, Botha going nowhere and he calls quickly to send his partner, who was a third of the way down the pitch, scrambling back
horrible wide to kick off his second spell
banged in, O'Brien ducks and it clips his shoulder as he goes down. A half-hearted appeal from somewhere, even though the ball was taken by Ramdin on the bounce
another bouncer, this time successfully ducked. But why is that not a no-ball as that's two in a row?
full and driven up to mid-off
at 70mph, that was almost 20mph slower than the previous ball but O'Brien reads it
pushed to cover, Smith on it quickly and O'Brien would have been run-out by yards at the non-striker's end had the throw hit
wide, driven through the covers, good placement
starts with a no-ball, driven square and a good one-handed pick-up by third man sprinting round to his right
Botha back to steer the ball into the covers
too much width once more, controlled drive wide of third man who makes up good ground
decent response (77.3mph) forcing Botha to jab down quickly
Botha down on one knee to play a slashing Caribbean-style drive ... the shame is he missed
Botha plays a drive on the walk, mid-off fields
yet again Bravo invites the cover drive by bowling too wide and the offer is accepted
Botha forward, watchful
and again, all very safe
worked drive wide of mid-on
O'Brien forward and steers to point
driven up to longish-on, easy run
short, Botha back but doesn't time it and the ball is easily fielded by short extra cover
slower ball, O'Brien waits and punches the ball behind point
short, Botha thinks about hooking, thinks again and pulls out of the shot
flicked to leg side, neatly placed
O'Brien back to block, very correct and the ball bangs into the ground at his feet and bobbles off to safety
a missed swish to leg, the ball runs off the pads and into the on side, a rather weak appeal from the bowler but that was heading down the leg
Lara, despite advancing years, throws himself to his right at short extra, to save the run. Big cheers and Lara rather stiffly regains his feet
backfoot poke, missed
plopped into the off side
down the track, flicked to Lara at short midwicket
pushed to backward point, good quick call from the non striker
gently turns past the bat, it went with the arm, an appeal but not likely to be given as it hit him outside the line
pushed into the off side
creasebound block, a thin inside edge saved him from a certain lbw
more assured, safely defended
short, trampoline bounce and O'Brien swings at air as it passes over his shoulder
slower 67mph ball, gently driven to Lara at short extra cover
O'Brien right back on his stumps to block
another swish and a miss, the ball was heading down the leg side anyhow, but it bobbles out square and they get the leg bye
O'Brien misses a really slow one ... somehow
cross-batted heave, loud appeal as he misses but just outside the line
patted to  mid-on
another miss, this time trying an expansive drive
worked round the corner, at least that breaks the stranglehold
clipped square for one
Botha forward, blocks, no alarms, little excitement for the large Irish contingent
I spoke too soon! A cracking drive hit straight back over Bravo's head for six. Lovely shot and that's woken the crowd up
into the leg side off the pad
O'Brien right back, drops the ball at his feet and it bounces over and past the stumps
shapes to flick to leg, gets a thick edge into his thigh and Ramdin quickly round to field as the ball heads to the wide open spaces in the slips
O'Brien stands tall, punches to point who is in like a comet ... well, quite quickly
steps back and cuts to the man in the deep at backward point
driven back to Gayle who fields with ease
two steps, gently flicked into the leg side
stands tall and drops three yards into the off, a good, quick run
flicked off a thick edge to deep square leg
premeditated paddle more than a sweep, over Ramdin's shoulder
taken from outside off and smashed uppishly, but safely, through midwicket
defended this time
outside off, full delivery, and that's driven strongly through cover, leaning into that shot
short and the batsman pulls out of that one, turning his back and getting out of the way just in time as that fires past his shoulder
ducks down and allows that straight bouncer - oh, it's a wide - to fly way above him
slower delivery and there's a scream of an LBW shout but that pitched outside leg stump
another bouncer to end the over has the batsman sitting on the floor in his efforts to avoid that one
drags that one a touch short outside off and that's driven off the back foot into the covers
driven off the front foot this time, to the sweeper on the off side
outside off and that's taken from there and swept, on one knee, to midwicket
"Catch it, Brav", says Ramdin but the chip back bounced way short
another chip, another one very short
waits patiently and then turns that one to short fine leg
on off, the batsman gets over that and works it without much power to short midwicket
right up there and that crashes into the pad, maybe with a touch of edge, outside the line
worked off the back foot to just inside the cover boundary
outside off, full, and that's driven without much power to cover
wide outside off, that turns in just a touch, and is promptly driven back out to cover
driven to the man sweeping on the off-side boundary for another tame single
defended forward
tries to sweep that one off the pads, as it pitches on off and turns back to leg
got it away this time, but only to long-on
short delivery and that one's sent high to Sarwan running way in off the rope at midwicket and he holds on comfortably
comes forward to defend on the front foot, and kill the bounce
more stifling defence on the front foot, the ball pushed right up there
nudged to the on side for a couple to get off the mark first ball
defended on the front foot, the ball pitching just outside off and on a good length
shuffled into the covers but they decide not to run
played off the back foot behind point and they do run this time
on leg and that's rushed into the leg side
attempted bouncer, doesn't quite get it right, with one that rushes over leg and keeps swinging on
outside off and he tries to cut over that one - but that's just too wide
that was close and there was some confusion in trying to rotate the strike so much
defended forward
dinked down and they choose the single this time
swept up off one knee and that's popped into the leg side
defended down off the back foot
played down off the back foot once more
down leg and that's chased down by the batsman, but with no success
played down off the back foot backward of point
defended forward, looking for the straight drive, but it's not on
short and that's defended down into space
that one's rushed past the outside edge
too much width on off and that's driven out to extra cover - they were looking for two, but Samuels has a good arm, there
short, outside off, and that's defended down off the back foot
pitches straight and that's defended forward
goes to pull that one and that's outside-edged high to gully and that's easily held
defended forward
skewed round behind square
full and that's defended forward off the toes
inched off the front foot to square
on target and the batsman can't force that one away
down on one knee and swept square
played square again
helped that one on its way with a fine tickle through fine leg and that's a rare, but welcome, boundary
nudged into midwicket, but straight to the fielder
same ball, same result
on the money and the batsman can't get any purchase
tries to sweep that to fine leg
short, straight and that's picked into the midwicket region
defended again
single round to the 45
waits and brings his wrists over it to work it down to Lara at midwicket
outside off and that jinks back in to the righthander who works that in front of midwicket
straighter and that dibble into midwicket brings up Ireland's 150
on off stump and that's defended forward
glanced off the toes in front of midwicket but they turn down the idea of a second
straight, and defended forward
eased behind square for a quick single
reverse swept to short third man
swept to square leg again
tries to sweep, doesn't get hold of it
comes forward and stands tall to defend with a straight bat
turned off the toes into square
on a good length, outside off, and that's worked to point
nips back in off the seam and that's turned into the square
right up there, quicker one, "Oh yes, Samuels", and the batsman does well to dig it out - he knows it, too, laughing
defended forward this time
taken from outside off and swept right out to the midwicket boundary
turned to midwicket, but straight to the fielder
attempted reverse sweep edges into his helmet, but he's unscathed
short and that's helped out to the midwicket boundary where Chanderpaul throws it back in
slower ball, not very well disguised, and that's worked out to the sweeper on the off-side boundary
leans back, cuts over the vacant slips and third man fields
slower ball, he waits ... and waits ... and eventually prods the ball into the covers
White steps across in an attempt to paddle the ball round the corner - fine leg is up - but he misses and Bravo hits
an absolute snorter, on a line, rasping through at chest height and Mooney gloves it, Ramdin doing the rest. Two in two for Bravo, and Mooney's World Cup debut ends within seconds
short, pulled round the corner
faster one, fired it at off stump, he jabs the bat down just in time and squirts the ball to backward point
paddled through midwicket, no second to Smith
quicker delivery, hit limply back and Samuels across to field
full toss, a big swish which he slices, and that takes it for four square on the off
another quicker one, squeezed out on the leg
speared in at leg stump, right through the prod, a loud appeal but heading down the leg, it cannons off the pad and into the off side
slower ball, McCallan waits and punches it through the covers, but there's a man in the deep
swung high into the covers, Powell sprints round from long-on and his lunge just falls short. Great attempt ... he must have run 30 yards
slower one, full, the batsman swung far too early and missed, again a loud shout and another not-out call. It looked close but the replay showed the umpire was spot on
a slow - 62mph - off break which thoroughly bamboozles the batsman and he swipes at air
no-ball, McCallan paddles a slower one round the corner, very fine, and Taylor cannot quite cut it off. His sprint takes him over the rope and into the dressing-rooms ...
driven to long-on, Powell was slow as he never thought they would try for the second, but they did and he was left looking a bit red faced

inn2.comm: a very good awayswinger to a righthander, alas, for he is of left-handville
it's close to the off stump but it's not out
swung in at the lefthander and that's dug out on the front foot
outside off and that goes down the corridor and it's left alone
swings back in at the lefthander who leaves that outside off
on leg and that's pinged square
swung right away down off
short and that's pulled round to square
huge outside edge over the slips and that's two bounces for a four and the photographer misses it
played in front of square off the front foot
down leg and that was chased round
full, on leg, and that's an attempt to play it through square
slower ball and that's on a good length, defended forward
worked out to square
flung that one past the outside edge
angled that one too wide down off
driven through the covers
short, wide and that's dabbed down into the covers
outside off and that's driven to cover
outside off and that's nearly chopped back into the stumps... but just misses
on off and that's worked into short midwicket
good length, asking the question. Bravo had the answer, this time, leaving that one outside off
on off, a touch short, and that's driven away off the toes through midwicket
played in front of midwicket
on off and that's driven in front of midwicket once more
played off the toes to square and there's a good tumbling save from Kevin O'Brien
rushed that one past the outside edge and it's just left alone - time's on West Indies' side, of course, with the asking rate under 4 even at this early stage
having said that, that one's walloped over mid-on, watch out for your hats, and that fair clatters into the boards

got him! There was no need to play that shot, in all fairness, but Gayle gets a head rush, going for glory, and Langford-Smith changes his pace, Bravo on through that one too quickly to mid-off and there's a tidy enough catch
played into the ground at mid-off and there's plenty of movement as the inner ring closes in as one - Ireland are up for this, and that wicket's really pricked their attention
driven straight to the man at cover
shapes over off stick and that one's just poked down in defence
chased that one down leg as it rises through to the keeper
outside off and that's left alone
down leg and that's chased down again
pitched straight and that's played off the front foot to midwicket
straight, short and Chanderpaul squares up to that one, the ball flying off the outside edge in front of point
slower ball, dabbed into the covers and an easy single results through a fumble
outside off and that's left alone on its way through to O'Brien
defended down on the front foot
on off and that's pushed to the man at cover
drags that a touch short and it's worked out into the off side for an easy enough single
angles in at the righthander, cutting in off the seam on off and that's defended tidily
left alone outside off
ooh, tentative shot - full and batsman lobs the bowler, stopping on the shot, just short of mid-off
good delivery ends the over, jagging that past the outside edge
hits outside leg stick, and raps the batsman's leg. There's a hint of swing but no trouble for the umpire
opens the face, stance square of the wicket, and that's worked down to wide third man
straight, and that's squeezed to mid-off
outside off and that's played down off the back foot into the covers
short, outside off, and Chanderpaul just walks into that firm cut, but some quick work from the fielder to cannon that one back ensures there's just a single
played down off the back foot back past the bowler and it's easily picked up by the fielder
shot, and that's played off the back foot behind point. Martin does his best Tony Greig impression to describe that one "Gone like an exocet missile". It's a laugh a minute here
defended forward this time
Chanderpaul creeps down the wicket and that's driven straight
on off and that's worked to short midwicket
outside off and that's worked in front of square, but McCallan cuts off the second
some snappy footwork from Langford-Smith to cut off the drive
poked into the covers
now that is a nice shot - Chanderpaul at his best, with a flowing straight drive which rockets along the ground at top speed
short, too short, and that's pulled away very easily, the crowd swaying while signalling four for themselves
what an eye. Just a touch short but that's despatched first-class through midwicket with a crisp, firm pull
strayed down leg and that's played round through fine leg
driven to cover but Paul Mooney does ever so well to run round and dive at full stretch to cut that one off
driven to mid-off
driven to mid-on this time, just for fun
aerial drive through cover but safe
outside off but straight to the man at cover
straight drive stopped by the bowler who did very well to stop it with his right hand
left alone outside off and that's just to say wide, but no doubt that it was
driven to mid-off
driven back to mid-off, without much power, where it's picked up easily enough
short, but Chanderpaul didn't get hold of that one which he was looking to send to fine leg
outside off and Chanderpaul is drawn into prodding at that one
nicely cut away behind point
slower ball and that's worked into the covers
worked to short midwicket and there's some urgent calls from the field to get the ball back to the keeper, no need to worry, there wasn't a run on
tucks that one nicely away in front of midwicket, leaning over the ball and driving it away
short, outside off, and that's dabbed down off the back foot
on leg and that's worked into the covers off the back foot
outside off and cut away off the back foot behind point
short, more width, and that's middled with a cut shot behind point
outside off and that's driven to the covers where it's well fielded by Morgan
on leg and that's worked in front of square
back, blocked and fielded
Botha gently swings it into the right hander, and he in turn gently plays it away
"Bowling .. bowling ... top bowling," shouts O'Brien. Indeed. On the spot it is
almost a yorker, dug out and it scoots to mid-off
full toss. swatted to mid-off
good start, on off stump, blocked. "Top drawer," accord to O'Brien, Ireland's answer to Paul Nixon
slightly shorter with a sniff of seam into the batsman, patted to extra cover
pushed into the cover, they thought of a single but cover was in fast and they reconsidered and headed back
wide, cut hard to point but a good tumbling stop by McCallan
good darts, on the spot and Sarwan has to bide his time
cut to point again, right at the man
The teddy-bear bowler is smacked back over his head, it was in the slot, slower  and Chanderpaul was on it like a panther
worked to leg, there's a man in the deep at wide long-on
Sarwan whips that to midwicket
slightly short, hammered over midwicket with power, the man in the deep was there to save the four
patted back to the bowler, good response
steered down to third man
sublime. Chanderpaul timed that cut oh-so-well, he threaded the ball to the left of backward point
a long hop, Chanderpaul onto it quickly, pulling it square and there is nobody out there. This is his 45th one-day fifty and it came up from 52 balls with seven fours and a six
caressed into the off side but this time he doesn't find the gap
sweet,sweet flick over midwicket. There's a man back that that deserved four ... Ireland need to stop him somehow ...
firm drive into the hands of extra cover
deft cut, very late and very fine
full, driven up to long-on
Chanderpaul smacks that from off stump past midwicket and there's no way the man in the deep could get that
and again, the previous shot was power, this one was touch, run off a deliberate edge through the gap in the slips
the best of the lot ... hit on the up, timed and the ball lands yards over the long-on boundary. The crowd are on fire, so is Chanderpaul, and Botha is dumping petrol on the blaze
steered to cover, a dot ball!
and again Chanderpaul happy to pat the ball into the off side
an easy single to get Chanderpaul back on strike
punched off the back foot into the off side
Chanderpaul tried to sweep Mooney, got a thick top edge ... it seemed that it had to go nowhere other than up and out, but it went all the way over third man
angled to third man
pushed towards mid-on but midwicket across to thwart the single
driven past a flailing extra cover, Sarwan thought about the two but Chanderpaul, who was running back to the danger end, was not interested
gentle and outside off, Sarwan dismissively swats that over midwicket
Sarwan forward and then back as McCallan sees him coming and fires one in
a cry of anguish from O'Brien as Sarwan gets a thick inside edge and the ball shoots past the stumps
to square leg
pushed into the off side
flicked fine on the leg side. Sarwan nicks the strike for the second over in succession
squirted to backward point who goes to his knees to field
slammed through the covers, the man out in the deep prevents more than a single
Chanderpaul waits and then places the ball into the leg side
full outside off stump, steered to point
driven firmly along the ground to mid-off
yes! And the groan around the ground is audible. Wide and he flat-batted that to the man sweeping on the off
Sarwan drive but to extra cover
looks for a leg-side flick, misses, and the ball thumps into his pads. He was off balance there ...
cut but yet again he finds the man and not the gap
an almost apologetic paddle to square leg
Chanderpaul forward and pats the ball into the off side
well flighted, Chanderpaul again waits and does no more than push the ball to cover
good start, Sarwan forward, takes two strides as he plays the ball into the off before he is sent back
up in the blockhole, well dug out
turned off middle and leg, a diving stop by short midwicket saves the one
tight bowling supported by good fielding ... into the off side from Sarwan and again he cannot get a run
driven back to the bowler, O'Brien picks it up and shapes to have a throw, Sarwan leaps to his right but O''Brien doesn't let go
at last Sarwan hits up and over, lofting the ball high towards the long-on boundary
Chanderpaul blocks as if he had not faced a ball yet ... well, he has hardly had any of the strike of late
pushed to extra cover
flicked round the corner, not middled, and the keeper out to prevent the run
patted to cover point ... all very low key but tight bowling to be credited
plopped to extra cover
Chanderpaul pushes the ball between cover and extra cover for the single
full toss, pushed back to the bowler with no force ... it barely got there
he steps back and cuts the ball to third man
confident off drive through to the sweeper
weka drive to the right of the bowler, he goes to field but checks as he realises mid-off will do the bending for him
waits and turns the ball round the corner, calls for the single with a strange noise, a bit like a chicken
Sarwan steps back and plays a late, late dab to third man, no real pace and the fielder has time to get round the boundary
Chanderpaul takes a step to get to the pitch of the ball, hits against the spin and lofts it over cow corner
Chanderpaul forward and then a shimmy back, waits and drives through the gap in the covers
Sarwan blocks. He's hapopy to let his colleague do the work while he tries to bat his way out of a trough
pushed back to the bowler
clipped to short midwicket

loose and uppish drive, McCallan dives to his right but the ball drops just short. He was down well to that, but Sarwan couldn't buy a well-timed shot at the moment. The key is, however, he's still there
pushed into the off side, point fields
mistimed drive, aimed on the off, it bobbled to mid-on
workmanlike steer to third man
Sarwan drives crisply past a diving extra cover, not well enough to get a boundary but well enough to perk him up a bit
Sarwan back and cuts late, controlled and a run to third man
bobbly drive, extra cover round to pick-up one handed on the bounce
Sarwan comes down the pitch and smacks the ball high and far over cow corner. Good use of the feet and it's dropped in the crowd
again he comes down the track, this time he drives along the ground but it's well stopped
thumping drive but Morgan makes a really good sprawling stop at extra cover
Sarwan's torment is over. He again used his feet to get to the ball but his slog-sweep wasn't middled and Kevin O'Brien at deepish midwicket got under it and clung on
Chanderpaul almost yorks himself by taking two steps and treading on the ball, he whirled round as he had no idea where it went, but got back in time as the keeper raced out
pushed into the off side
full toss, merely patted to mid-off with a dead bat
Samuels back and jabs down on the ball
wide, Samuels cuts that off the back foot and the ball scorches the turf. Timed beautifully, it purred
he reached for that and hammered the drive,Mooney at cover made a good stop to his left. That would have stung ...
good response, angled in at off stump and Samuels happy to block
firm drive and a diving stop at extra cover, it bounced kindly but he still had to react quickly
two steps and then a block
pushed to cover, Chanderpaul was off for the single but Samuels going nowhere ... Chanderpaul nods as if to say "good call"
bobbles into the leg side, nothing doing
he waits and steers behind square on the leg side
perfect forward defensive, watchful and correct
flicked back to the bowler
short, on leg, and that's swivelled round to fine leg
slower ball, full, and that's picked off the toes in front of square to bring up the 150
short, outside off, and that's late cut down from a squatting position
on leg and that's worked wristily behind square
down leg and that's driven off the toes, but crashes off the pads, behind square
short, across the off stick and that's eased down to the backward point boundary
on off and that pops into space at short midwicket
driven to cover off the front foot
oops, another one to the total
poked down to short leg
played forward back to the bowler
played down behind point
in at the off stump and that's driven back to the bowler
dabbed down and there's a single into the covers
angled in at the righthander who drives it back to cover
dragged it down, wide, and that's driven away through cover
on leg and that's dinked into midwicket
outside off and that's driven off the back foot, on the balls of his toes, to cover
driven to long-on
looks like he's spooned that up off the bat - but in fact it was the pad - and the keeper comes round, takes the 'catch' and throws it into the air
defended forward
driven back to the bowler
on off and that's defended back towards the bowler
played into the covers
played to midwicket
straight and Samuels drives a lovely straight drive back past the bowler but there's a man out there and he restricts the batsmen to a single
played into short midwicket
quick single, and Chanderpaul is veering towards his hundred
defended forward
on leg and that's worked to midwicket
cuts back from outside off in to the righthander who plays at the top of the bounce into cover
on middle and that's driven out to long-off
stopped by Morgan at cover, a bump-ball
defended forward
more defence
this time the batsman comes down the track and drives to mid-on
beat him with the quicker one
outside off and that's defended forward
defended forward
the crowd erupt as Chanderpaul brings up his ... 99, with a crashing drive
flights in a slower delivery, not testing, outside off and that's Chanderpaul's sixth one-day hundred, his first in World Cups
firm drive off the back foot to mid-on for a quick single
on middle and that's driven to mid-on
outside off and that's driven straight to the man at cover
played off the back foot into the gap backward of point with a fine diving stop which just prolongs home-time for everyone, I mean, the fun for the crowd
but it's worth hanging around for that one! Steps into that one, great use of his feet, and that's sent high and wide in front of midwicket
squirted out to midwicket
driven out to mid-on
right up there on off and that's prodded into short cover
waist-high full toss and that's bunted over midwicket to end the match in style. A convincing victory for West Indies here, they were never challenged, in truth
